XMLlist.entry: Interacts from an anonymous reader's point of view
Do a simple search

The type of research: 0 (SEARCH_ALL)=all the fields, 1 (SEARCH_TITLE)=title, 2 (SEARCH_AUTHOR)=author, 3 (SEARCH_EDITOR)=editor, 4 (SEARCH_COLLECTION)=collection, 6 (SEARCH_CATEGORIES)=categories/subject heading words

Retrieve the records resulting of a search, applying the sorting rules

The SortType parameter builds itself the following way: typedutri_nomdutri, with: -typedutri: d or c for an ascending or descending sorting -nomdutri: the id of the sorting (see the get_sort_types function).
examples: -c_text_1: sort by ascending title. -d_num_7: sort by descending year of edition. -c_text_5: sort by ascending call number.
the id returned by the search function
number of the first record to retrieve
number of records to retrieve
results format
the charset in which we want the results
include the links between the records, issues and articles
include the copies in the zone 995
the sorting rule to apply to the results

Retrieve the records resulting of a search, applying the sorting rules

The sortType parameter builds itself the following way: typedutri_nomdutri, with: -typedutri: d or c for an ascending or descending sorting -nomdutri: the id of the sorting (see the get_sort_types function).
examples: -c_text_1: sort by ascending title. -d_num_7: sort by descending year of edition. -c_text_5: sort by ascending call number.

Retrieves a list of records from their ids, in a specified format
Care about the requirements of the protocols in terms of charset if you use this function. For example, if you use SOAP, you will have to manage the records in utf-8.

Returns the list of different ways to sort

Example of return : Array ( [0] => Array ( [sort_name] => text_1 [sort_caption] => Title )
[1] => Array ( [sort_name] => num_2 [sort_caption] => Decimal indexation )
[2] => Array ( [sort_name] => text_3 [sort_caption] => Author ) ... )
Do a simple search filtered by location and section

The search type: 0 (SEARCH_ALL)=All fields, 1 (SEARCH_TITLE)=title, 2 (SEARCH_AUTHOR)=author, 3 (SEARCH_EDITOR)=editor, 4 (SEARCH_COLLECTION)=collection, 6 (SEARCH_CATEGORIES)=categories/Subject heading words
string to search
the id of a pmb user, to filter the results depending on the access point. -1: to not take it into account
the id of a borrower, to filter the results, depending on the access rights -1: Do not take into account 0: anonymous borrower x: id of the borrower
name of the resource result
number of results found
Location
Section
